about.quote: Ship fast, ship right. Optimize later, but measure always.

skills.title: Technical Skills
skills.subtitle: Technologies and tools I work with

projects.title: Featured Projects
projects.subtitle: A selection of work I'm proud of

items.name: CompileS
items.shortDescription: Browser-based code compiler and execution platform
items.longDescription: Inspired by HackerEarth and HackerRank, CompileS is a Node.js application that compiles user code directly from the browser. It takes program inputs from the browser and displays output within the browser. Users can also execute code from GitHub and Gist without downloading, making it convenient for quick code testing and sharing.
items.challenge: Developers often need to quickly test code snippets without setting up local environments. Existing solutions require account creation or don't support remote code execution from GitHub/Gist.
items.solution: Built a full-stack Node.js application with browser-based code compilation. Integrated GitHub and Gist APIs to allow direct code execution from URLs. Implemented secure sandboxed execution environment to safely run user-submitted code.
items.impact: Enables instant code testing without local setup. Supports multiple programming languages. Streamlines code sharing and execution workflow for developers.

items.name: Sentiment Analysis Chat Application
items.shortDescription: Real-time chat with emotion detection using IBM Watson
items.longDescription: A real-time chatting application with sentiment analysis capabilities. Built using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js), Socket.io for real-time communication, and IBM Tone Analyzer for emotion detection. The app analyzes messages in real-time and provides insights into the emotional tone of conversations.
items.challenge: Traditional chat applications lack emotional context. Understanding the sentiment behind messages can improve communication and help identify mood patterns in conversations.
items.solution: Developed full-stack MERN application with Socket.io for real-time bidirectional communication. Integrated IBM Watson Tone Analyzer API to analyze message sentiment and display emotional indicators. Implemented MongoDB for storing chat history and sentiment data.
items.impact: Provides real-time sentiment feedback during conversations. Helps users understand emotional tone and improve communication. Demonstrates practical application of AI in everyday communication tools.

items.name: Timezone Converter
items.shortDescription: Instant timezone conversion between major world cities
items.longDescription: A lightweight and intuitive timezone converter that converts time instantly as you type. Use it to convert time between major world cities, countries, and timezones in both directions. The application provides a clean, user-friendly interface for quick timezone calculations without complex configurations.
items.challenge: Coordinating meetings across multiple timezones is challenging. Existing converters are often cluttered with ads or require multiple steps to get results.
items.solution: Built a fast, responsive web application with instant conversion as you type. Implemented bidirectional timezone conversion supporting major world cities. Focused on clean UX with minimal UI and zero friction for quick lookups.
items.impact: Simplifies timezone coordination for remote teams and international communication. Instant results without page reloads. Clean, distraction-free interface focused on usability.

items.name: Markit
items.shortDescription: Live preview markdown editor for Linux and Windows
items.longDescription: Markit is a cross-platform live preview markdown editor available for Linux and Windows. It allows HTML and CSS along with markdown, providing developers and writers with a powerful, flexible editing environment. Real-time preview ensures what you write is what you see, making markdown editing more intuitive and productive.
items.challenge: Markdown editors often lack live preview or don't support HTML/CSS, limiting flexibility. Many web-based editors don't work offline or lack desktop app features.
items.solution: Built a native desktop application using Electron for cross-platform compatibility. Implemented live markdown rendering with support for HTML and CSS. Provided split-pane interface showing markdown source and rendered output side-by-side.
items.impact: Gives developers and writers a powerful offline markdown editor. Supports extended markdown with HTML/CSS for greater flexibility. Cross-platform support for both Linux and Windows users.
